subject: Re: box use concerns.
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Just exagerating a bit, cuz one was scared of it. Misty says her 
guys would talk about 33 all the time, like it was a pivotal event.

 FS

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> 
wrote:
>
> Why do you call 33 the Devils Box, everybody is scared of?
> 
> purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:          The lack 
of boxes actually spawned the hack, so everything for a 
> reason. Just the parts for mine are more than $25 bucks, and the 
> hack is almost as good, it does the job. 
> 
> Maybe, if I quit going off on tangents, and just get some boards 
> professionally done....
> 
> I did have a couple boards made last fall for the LA1816, but the 
> radio turned out to be just c-r-a-p-p-eee, I just set them aside. 
> One all the wiring is done, and one is just the bare board. They 
are 
> mostly SMT components. If there are some real techno-gurus out 
> there, I don't have a problem giving these boards away. The AM 
band 
> works, but it's kinda noisy, which could be just the wrong choice 
of 
> IF cans, or maybe the RF amp. These are second gen boards for the 
> LA1816, the first one I had the pin spacing too close for the 
radio 
> chip. They have RVG, and linear, which also may contribute to 
noise. 
> Randy Schnieder has one of these, that was 25, now I can't 
remember 
> what I did with 26, the ones I have on hand would be 28, and as 
yet 
> an unassigned number. Oh yeah, Randy went halfers with the cost, 
so 
> he has 26. 
> 
> 1 sits on my shelf.
> 2 uesd for parts
> 3 parts
> 4,5,6-larry in Arkansas-claims that none worked. 
> 7 Moon
> 8-Moon
> 9-Moon
> 10-Moon
> 11=Crappy-used for parts
> 12 =Juli
> 13 distroyed
> 14 Moon These two wer the second PCB version using ExpressPCB's
> mini boards. hummm, there should be three of these.
> 15-Randy's
> 16--was there a 16?
> 17 Don't remember
> 18 not finished -these were the first home made tuenr boards, and
> not so good.
> 19 not finished
> 20 now in Moon hands
> 21 Murphy
> 22 REG
> 23 REG
> 
> 24=proto-type LA1816--mine
> 25=PCB LA1816--Randy's
> 26=" " don't rmemeber ---Randy
> 27=Hand wired LA1816-Steve H. 
> 28-unfinished PCB-LA1816
> 29== Hand wired LM3820=Bruce 
> 30=Hand wired protoype LM3820 with shortwave--mine.
> 31--Hand wired using car AM tuner module--Ann's
> 32-- " " " " " " Going out bill Murphy
> 
> 33 Hand wired LA1135, the devil box everyone is scared of. 
> 
> 34=hand wired with car tuner==goni got Chip Coffey, if he ever
> e-mails back.
> 35-hand wired ultra compact LA1135, not finished--mine
> 36 hand wired using the RS '469 as the tuner- almost finished
> 37 " " " " " " "--April Slaughter. 
> 
> Translation; Uncounted thousands of hours of life spent sitting in 
> the basement. 
> 
> Frank-s
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > I think it is all an alter ego problem, certain people think 
they 
> are blessed to have one of your boxes. Hell I could only wish to 
> have one myself, but I know that their is not enough to go around, 
> and also know that I probably will never be able to get one. So 
I'm 
> content to have my Radio Shack Hack, without the ego problem. 
> That's fine with me, I feel great about being a member of this 
> group, and making some friends. Maybe some day I might be able to 
> use what I learn from y'all to build something for myself. 
> > 
> > Later Guys, and have a great day
> > 
> > William Rees 
> > 
> > 
> > Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > Hi All; We have been warned by others from time to time 
> about unbridled box use, as it supposedly brings in negativity. I 
> don't want to believe that, but there are a few cases of people 
> using boxes made by me, as well as the hack radios, and going 
whacko 
> big time. Its' either all ego--I'm the onlyest one that can use 
> this, or like the more recent example. I don't know if these 
people 
> were like this to start, or if it's an external influance, but 
it's 
> discouraging. There seems to be a similar reaction with systems 
not 
> made by me--so I've been told.
> > 
> > Soooo, maybe burn some white candles, and maybe get a Rosary. My 
> guys talk about the Catholics, and the Purple Princess has a 
> Catholic connection on the etheric levels, although the church 
> imposes too many limits on her. I wouldn't want to go into a state 
> of fear, but a little protection stuff couldn't hurt. 
> > 
> > Not only do I not have the time to mass produce boxes, I'm 
> beginning to think it's not a good idea anyway. 
> > 
> > Frank-S
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > ---------------------------------
> > Express yourself wherever you are. Mobilize! 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> >

> > Be a better friend, newshound, and know-it-all with Yahoo! 
> Mobile. Try it now.
> >
